raw.title: [BIP-598] Claim Extra Safe Airdrop
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
# Payload with PR

https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/920


# Abstract


[GIP-64](https://snapshot.org/#/gnosis.eth/proposal/0xd9dbc0cebba7b9a27f6fa3f30987b89b4dd50140ee3e21624ebc9bdb16049654) prompted GnosisDAO to distribute an additional portion of the SAFE supply, aimed at promoting decentralisation on the Gnosis Chain. In the context of a [token swap agreement](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0x8d4969e56fa8eb13abc7a3404b3d42fe6b4afa1c7f29111bd012314f093a2fd2), Balancer DAO received GNO tokens from GnosisDAO, which were then locked in the [LGNO locking contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x4f8ad938eba0cd19155a835f617317a6e788c868). This deposit qualifies the Balancer DAO for these additional benefits, as it satisfies the requirement of having "GNO in locking contracts on Ethereum and Gnosis Chain." The current proposal aims to claim 119,196.473 Safe tokens, receiving them in the  [Balancer DAO treasury](https://etherscan.io/address/0x10a19e7ee7d7f8a52822f6817de8ea18204f2e4f).


# Specification

The DAO Multisig on Ethereum Mainnet ```0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f``` will interact with the SAFE contract at ```0x20cF5bA8aBA68Cd7Ca3d0cAfAc54dA807c772418``` and write the claim function for the total amount allocated, passing 
  
```"0xe3f30724dc7b68f4dc7bef54b812e18454d9b9b278887f4f09de5ee8dd2fbb97"```                                        ,                                                                                      ```"0x403b039b300b5d3f14f5a95011807ad1f279c31b5c6668e9dad1cbd43d5d9271"```                                         ,                                                 ```"0x25ddc11367cfc9aeab1086adcc396ffdaeb90e491021ab488fcacd43037cd4e6"```                                        ,                                                                                                  ```"0xc2628e8800f0dbbce626dcf83c09a30a5a97d79413dcb79ca32a75d3cc1e66b8"```                                        ,
```"0x933f0c6611414cc50cc739051a4e8140ca04f4ca6113746cedf8e9174aa9a6df"]```

for the ```merkleProof``` argument, and ```119196472786989781864064``` for the ```amountAllocated``` argument.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-423] Enable new wstETH gauges [Gnosis Chain]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/499

## [BIP-418] Enable new wstETH gauges [Gnosis Chain]

With the goals of maximising capital efficiency in Gnosis Chain, we have been doing some analysis into whatâ€™s the optimal liquidity structure. Therefore, we propose to enable some gauges.

### Gauges to enable:

`50wstETH-50staBAL3`

`50wstETH-25AURA-25BAL`

`50wstETH-50COW`

`50wstETH-50GNO`

### Implementation:

|Pool|Pool address|Gnosis Chain gauge|Mainnet gauge|
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
|wstETH/staBAL3|[0xeb30c85cc528537f5350cf5684ce6a4538e13394](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xeb30c85cc528537f5350cf5684ce6a4538e13394)|[0xef23c2ec60a1ea3ed6a44681fb72356cb411177e](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xef23c2ec60a1ea3ed6a44681fb72356cb411177e)|[0xf0d3268d36Adf812Fa69756500D72A899D4c2420](https://etherscan.io/address/0xf0d3268d36Adf812Fa69756500D72A899D4c2420)|
|wstETH/GNO|[0x4683e340a8049261057D5aB1b29C8d840E75695e](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x4683e340a8049261057D5aB1b29C8d840E75695e)|[0xb812249d60b80c7cbc9398e382ed6dfdf82e23d2](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xb812249d60b80c7cbc9398e382ed6dfdf82e23d2)|[0xb1af0D75AEEa1c13c450ffc7e12083072DAf41eb](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb1af0D75AEEa1c13c450ffc7e12083072DAf41eb)|
|wstETH/COW|[0x4cdABE9E07ca393943AcFB9286bBbd0D0a310Ff6](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x4cdABE9E07ca393943AcFB9286bBbd0D0a310Ff6)|[0xce18a3d0d928ab8883f355b5009d2de07d5c1d83](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xce18a3d0d928ab8883f355b5009d2de07d5c1d83)|[0x93AE6971F03CE890FA4e9274Ab441477b84DAE5f](https://etherscan.io/address/0x93AE6971F03CE890FA4e9274Ab441477b84DAE5f)|
|wstETH/AURA/BAL|[0x00dF7f58e1Cf932eBe5f54De5970Fb2Bdf0ef06D](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x00dF7f58e1Cf932eBe5f54De5970Fb2Bdf0ef06D)|[0x64cee2356f959e78db36a4c23a28f0454447c3df](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x64cee2356f959e78db36a4c23a28f0454447c3df)|[0x64fCeD4684f4B065E6b900c4E99a0CBaCC5E5fe1](https://etherscan.io/address/0x64fCeD4684f4B065E6b900c4E99a0CBaCC5E5fe1)| 

### Specification:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd`and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0xf0d3268d36Adf812Fa69756500D72A899D4c2420`
gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`
gauge(address):`0xb1af0D75AEEa1c13c450ffc7e12083072DAf41eb`
gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`
gauge(address):`0x93AE6971F03CE890FA4e9274Ab441477b84DAE5f`
gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`
gauge(address):`0x64fCeD4684f4B065E6b900c4E99a0CBaCC5E5fe1`
gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-430] Enable Layer Zero Cross Chain Boosts on Base
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-430] Enable Layer Zero Cross Chain Boosts on Base
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/507

**Motivation**

With the recent move to enable the first wave of gauges on Base, it makes sense for cross chain boosts to be active on the network. As Base picks up steam, users will have an interest in receiving boost which will increase demand for veBAL. This also meets the status quo for all networks Balancer is deployed on, making the tokenomics homogenous for all network deployments. 

**Specification:**

1. 
The DAO Multisig `Base:0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x033f3ebfdc58141797e7786a8115159707118fe37ae8f6d7b98929e4465349fb`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/685c51a8fd147903939e5428c2545a3e765b5b88/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L57C36-L57C102).

account: `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 

The DAO Multisig `Base:0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the l2-ve-delegation-proxy `0xD87F44Df0159DC78029AB9CA7D7e57E7249F5ACD` calling `setDelegation` with the following argument:

`0xE42FFA682A26EF8F25891db4882932711D42e467`

which corresponds to the [l2-veboost-v2](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/800d649b60f01a50f2ba620a7cb6df4f4b0d6b80/addresses/base.json#L301) contract.

3. 
The DAO Multisig `Base:0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x033f3ebfdc58141797e7786a8115159707118fe37ae8f6d7b98929e4465349fb`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/685c51a8fd147903939e5428c2545a3e765b5b88/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L57C36-L57C102).

account: `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462`

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal aims to replace Trent with Gosuto as a multisig signer for the Karpatkey treasury manager multisigs on mainnet and Gnosis chain. Timeline voting data strongly favors approval with a stable and early lead. Forum sentiment is neutral with no opposition expressed. Similar past proposals with comparable changes also received strong support and positive or neutral market reactions.
key_arguments_for: Strong and stable early voting lead for 'Yes, let's do it' option.
The change aligns with prior multisig signer updates (e.g., BIP-681) improving governance key management.
Similar past proposals with multisig updates passed smoothly and had positive or neutral market/TVL impact.
Forum discussion shows no opposition and neutral sentiment towards the change.
key_arguments_against: No significant opposing arguments or negative sentiment found in the discussion.
Low total vote count (7), which may indicate limited community engagement on this specific update.

evidence.quote: Two neutral comments discussing the proposal details and link to the snapshot vote.
Lead ratio total is 1.0 for 'Yes, let's do it', stability 1.0, early voting ratio 1.0, indicating unanimous early support.
Similar proposals (BIP-685, BIP-686, BIP-687) with multisig or treasury management updates passed with strong 'Yes' votes and had positive or neutral market impact.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline voting dynamics, forum sentiment, and similar past proposal outcomes, independent of final vote tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline metrics show a unanimous and stable early lead for approval, signaling strong voter confidence.
- Forum comments are neutral, indicating no community opposition and a calm consensus.
- Similar past proposals on multisig signer changes have passed successfully with positive or neutral market responses, supporting this update's viability.
- Market impacts post-vote show positive price and TVL changes, reinforcing the benefit of approving this proposal.
- The recommendation aligns with the aggregated voter sentiment and forum discussion, supporting a change stance.
